item.title: Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs
item.description: An almost 100 year old movie, based on a story likely at least a century older, combining aspects of stories who knows how old, animated for the modern (of the time) movie going audience. It’s the beginning of a truely delightful era–that of the Disney animated classics. While they’ve certainly got their problems (the rather traditional gender roles and Disney’s ongoing copyright battles to name a pair), they’re still something elegant and innocent about them and Snow White is no exception.

item.title: Bambi
item.description:
Bambi is a surprisingly tricky movie to review, mostly since it relies on who’s doing the reviewing. From my perspective, it’s cute enough, but there’s next to nothing there. It’s just a bunch of cute animated animals running around for an hour. From my kids’ perspectives though… they loved it. They were laughing out loud at the cartoon antics and cuddled right in during the storm and hunt scenes.

Overall, it’s a fun enough movie for kids to watch, but I think next time they request it, I’ll find something else to do with my time. 😄
